title: Drawing, "Advertising Design for ShurEdge Knives: Santa's Hand", 20th century
medium: Color crayon, graphite on cream tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, below image (below center): and the memory lingers on!
provenance: James Howard Fraser; 2000: acquired by Museum
description: Large, pink Santa hand extending from right edge.  From his fingers, dangling on red strings, are three sets of boxed knives, while other fingers deftly balance a large knife.  In the palm of the hand is a  slight sketch in graphite of Santa's face. Below image is the caption: "and the memory linters on!" ; below caption is a series of  pale grey parallel lines (7 pairs) indicated the placement for the text.  Shur Edge logo (name linked across a silver pointed triangle),  lower right.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Advertising Design for ShurEdge Knives: Santa's Hand", 20th century.Color crayon, graphite on cream tracing paper. Gift of James Howard Fraser. 2000-68-4.
